document.docAuthor: Pinto, Taciana Kramer & Neres, Patricia Fernandes
document.docTitle: Stylotheristus multipapillatus Pinto & Neres 2020, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of free-living nematodes from shallow continental shelf of Portugal

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of free-living nematodes from shallow continental shelf of Portugal

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Five males and two females were collected at station 38. Holotype ( ♂ ) MUHNAC / MB 26–000028
.
Paratype ( ♀ ) MUHNAC / MB26–000029
.
Other paratypes : UFALPEN/ LEB 0014–018

Type Locality.
Sandy sediments adjacent to an artificial reef (Shipwreck) ( Table 1 )

Etymology. The specific epithet “
multipapillatus
” ( multis - meaning many) is given because the male this species presents several precloacal papillae.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 6. Measurements (μm) of
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
from the continental shelf of Portugal. All measurements in the form: mean ± standard deviation (range). (a = Body length/maximum body diameter, b = Pharynx length/ maximum body diameter, c = Tail length/maximum body diameter, c’ = Tail length/anal or cloacal body diameter, - = not applied, * = just one value or value same for all specimens).

tr.th: Amphideal fovea as % of corresponding body diameter
Distance of amphideal fovea from anterior end
Distance of nerve ring from anterior end
Body diameter in nerve ring region
Distance of cloaca from proximal precloacal supplements
Distance of cloaca from distal precloacal supplements
Distance of vulva from anterior end of body
Position of the vulva as % of body length from anterior end

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
holotype male: (A) anterior region (cephalic arrangement, amphideal fovea and buccal cavity), (B) copulatory apparatus (spicule and gubernaculum), (C) tail, (D) precloacal supplements and copulatory apparatus (spicule and gubernaculum), (E) testis.

FIGURE 15.
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
paratype female: (A) anterior region (cephalic arrangement, amphideal fovea and buccal cavity), (B) reproductive system, (C) tail.

FIGURE 16.
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
holotype male: (A) anterior region (buccal cavity and anterior portion of the pharynx–arrowhead marks conical setiform sensilla), (B) amphideal fovea, (C) tail, (D) spicule and gubernaculum, (E) and (F) papilliform precloacal supplements.

FIGURE 17.
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
paratype female: (A) anterior region (arrowheads mark conical setiform sensilla and amphideal fovea), (B) buccal cavity, (C) tail, (D) reproductive system (arrowhead marks vulva).

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Similar to male, except for cephalic sensilla arrangement, 6 conical papillae ( 4 µm ) + ten setae, six outer labial ( 24–31 µm ) and four cephalic setae ( 18.5–19 µm ) in the same circle. Oval amphideal fovea occupying 29–31% of corresponding body diameter. Buccal cavity 15.5 µm long and 19–23 µm in diameter (at its middle). Ovary outstretched and on left side of intestine. Vulva located posterior to mid-body (59–63% of total body length). Spermatheca not observed, only sperm cell inside the uterus. Tail 9.6–11 times anal body diameter, with three terminal setae ( 7–9 µm ).

Diagnosis.
Stylotheristus multipapillatus
sp. n.
is characterized by presence of precloacal supplements (papilliform) and the narrow gubernaculum narrow formed by only one piece.

Differential diagnosis. For the genus
Stylotheristus
, only one species was described,
S . mutilus
. The new species is similar to the species already described. The main characteristic features that differentiate them are present in the male, which are: the presence of precloacal supplements and gubernaculum formed by only one piece in the new species.
S . mutilus
has no supplements and the gubernaculum is formed by two pieces, one directed to the anterior part of the body (anterior to the spicules) and the other to the posterior part (posterior to the spicules). Besides that, the tail in the new species is shorter than that of
S. mutilus
, reflected by different values of c (tail length/maximum body diameter) and c’ (tail length/anal or cloacal body diameter) ( Table 7 ). In addition, in females of new species no spermathecae were observed, as in
S . mutilus
, only spermatozoa inside the uterus.
